title: CONDENSED SERIF MYSTERY
content:
Hello,

Saw this font at a Brothers Quay exhibition at MoMa. Doesn anyone know what it is? Thanks!

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20141031221234im_/http:/typophile.com/files/QUAY_4380.jpg)
author: talgoretsky

comments.content: closest i have is [FF Kath](http://web.archive.org/web/20141031221234/http:/typophile.com/wiki/https%3A/%252Fwww.fontfont.com/fonts/kath/condensed-regular). it's not the font you're looking for. still following breadcrumbs in hopes of helping you.

Could be a bespoke typeface. This exhibition at MoMA has been awarded by Type Directors Club 2013 and the complete alphabet is also showcased: [http://momadesignstudio.org/Quay-Brothers](http://web.archive.org/web/20141031221234/http:/momadesignstudio.org/Quay-Brothers "http://momadesignstudio.org/Quay-Brothers")  
Jodie found also the closest alternative I got. You may like also some " [Spire](http://web.archive.org/web/20141031221234/http:/www.myfonts.com/search/Spire)".

Red Rooster's "Pall Mall" is also similar, but this appears custom as Ryuk suggests.

- Mike Yanega
Thanks, everyone! I didn't realize this exhibit won an award. Your font suggestions are great.
